headline: News Corp to extend CEO's contract through June 2030, company says
summary: Thomson was appointed as CEO of News Corp, which owns the Wall Street Journal and book publisher HarperCollins, in 2013, and his contract was extended in 2023 until 2027.  "Robert has been instrumental in News Corp’s growth and transformation, and his vision and leadership are extremely important as the company continues to navigate this era of rapid change," Chair Lachlan Murdoch said in a statement.

headline: News Corp Extends CEO Robert Thomson’s Contract to 2030
summary: Thomson has pursued digital growth and focused the company on core areas of news, book publishing and digital real estate.

raw.headline: News Corp Extends CEO Robert Thomson’s Contract to 2030
raw.summary: Thomson has pursued digital growth and focused the company on core areas of news, book publishing and digital real estate.

headline: News Corp Extends Contract with Chief Executive Robert Thomson
summary: NEW YORK, June 22, 2025--News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS; NWSLV) announced today the extension of Robert Thomson’s contract, which will see him continue as Chief Executive through June 2030. The extension is a recognition of Mr. Thomson’s exceptional track record of transformational leadership, value creation and effective advocacy for journalism and intellectual property protection.

The extension is a recognition of Mr. Thomson’s exceptional track record of transformational leadership, value creation and effective advocacy for journalism and intellectual property protection.
